top_stories.title: How Google Cloud is shaping the enterprise AI inference moment
top_stories.description: Enterprise technology investment continues to accelerate, but the friction point has shifted. The hard part is no longer training models or selecting architectures. It’s getting those models into production, keeping them responsive under real-world conditions and proving they deliver value once they’re live. AI inference is where initiatives either prove their value or grind to […] The post How Google Cloud is shaping the enterprise AI inference moment appeared first on SiliconANGLE.

top_stories.title: AI agent-driven browser automation for enterprise workflow management
top_stories.description: Enterprise organizations increasingly rely on web-based applications for critical business processes, yet many workflows remain manually intensive, creating operational inefficiencies and compliance risks. Despite significant technology investments, knowledge workers routinely navigate between eight to twelve different web applications during standard workflows, constantly switching contexts and manually transferring information between systems. Data entry and validation tasks […]

top_stories.title: Faster agents, bigger blast radius: Why agent governance is the new control plane for resilience
top_stories.description: As enterprises accelerate their move toward autonomous workflows powered by artificial intelligence, the urgent need for robust AI agent governance has become a critical operational mandate. An agent’s potential relies on the fact that they can perform higher-level tasks, including assuming identities and executing business processes. But if that is compromised, attackers have effectively hijacked […] The post Faster agents, bigger blast radius: Why agent governance is the new control plane for...
